intro: Gilia gloriosa, commonly known as the showy gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces striking, showy flowers that range in color from pink to red, often with a white or yellow throat.
